intro: Lessingia glandulifera var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and have glandular structures, which contribute to its common name. This species is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
